newsitem.title: USA: Minnesota unemployment falls to 3.2 pct in June.
newsitem.headline: Minnesota unemployment falls to 3.2 pct in June.

text.p: Minnesota's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate dropped from 3.3 percent in May to 3.2 percent in June, continuing a record trend, Gov. Arne Carlson announced Thursday.

"These continuously record-breaking lows in the state's unemployment rates and the all-time high in the number employed this month are more evidence of Minnesota's robust economy," Carlson said in a statement.
The unadjusted rate rose from 2.7 percent in May to 3.6 percent in June, but still remained below the 4.5 percent unadjusted rate reported a year ago, Carlson noted.
The seasonally adjusted rate from one year ago was 4.1 percent, Carlson said.
The national seasonally adjusted unemployment rate for June hit 5 percent, up from the 4.8 percent reported in May.
